RepresentativeComplaints.Description: CHEVY SILVERADO TRUCK HAD EXHAUST LEAK(6.0LITER).  UPON INSPECTION, EXHAUST MANIFOLD BOLT HEADS WERE NOTED TO BE BROKEN OFF.  AFTER TALKING WITH OTHER SILVERADO OWNERS, THEY ALSO HAD THE SAME PROBLEM WITH THE EXHAUST MANIFOLD BOLTS. *TR

WHILE PULLING INTO MAIN HIGHWAY, ACCELERATOR PEDAL STUCK AND CAUSED VEHICLE TO ACCELERATE OUT OF CONTROL. VEHICLE HIT A TREE BEFORE STOPPING, CONSUMER STATED HE HAD TO KICK THE GAS PEDAL TO GET THE PEDAL UNSTUCK. DEALER AND MANUFACTURER WERE NOT NOTIFIED

WHILE DRIVING 40 MPH CONSUME R APPLIED THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL AND IT BECAME STUCK. THEN, CONSUMER APPLIED THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL SEVERAL TIMES AND  VEHICLE SUDDENLY ACCELERATED.  CONSUMER WAS ABLE TO MAINTAIN CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE, AND CONTACTED THE DEALER
WHEN APPLYING GAS CONSUMER HAS TO ALMOST STAND ON PEDAL TO GET PEDAL TO GO DOWN.  DEALER ADMITTED THERE WAS A PROBLEM WITH GAS PEDAL STICKING.*AK   *SLC

UPON BACKING UP TO LEAVE A PARKING LOT, IT WAS IMMEDIATELY APPARENT THERE WAS A LOSS OF BRAKE PEDAL, I.E. THE BRAKE PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR. THERE WAS ENOUGH BRAKE LEFT TO COME TO A STOP AND TO DRIVE TO THE NEAREST REPAIR SHOP, BUT DEFINITELY NOT SAFE TO
